website_summaries.verdict: Nine speeds create high-powered fun and near perfection for a versatile array of recipes.
pros: Superior in quality of structure and also results
Customers also appreciate that you can throw it in the dishwasher when done
Reduces the time it takes to whip up an egg
We also love the handsome, stainless steel aesthetic
cons: A bit heavy, weighing in at 4 pounds

website_summaries.verdict: With the attachments and power required by most cooks, this quality mixer more than gets the job done.
pros: Comfortable to hold and easy to handle
cons: "Slow start" is faster than some anticipate

customer_reviews.title: Terrible in so many ways
customer_reviews.text: 1) When it starts up, it revs up fast and then slows back down. Awful, if you don’t remember that it does this you will have a mess. 2) The ejectors for the beaters is in the trigger position, right where you pick up by the handle, and right where you would expect the On button to be. 3) It is SOOO LOUD. Really deafening. 4) The handy storage container is not so handy - the clip on mechanism is not reliable.
customer_reviews.author: gerard

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart--not a brand to trust any longer?
customer_reviews.text: Revised review from 5 stars to 1. Ugh. Loved it for 2 1/2 years, until tonight when it just didn't start. I have not used it much, maybe once a month over the last couple years. This thing should have lasted forever (or at least 5-10 years). Really disappointed. I will look for a different brand blender from now on. (BTW, still waiting for my replacement blade for my food processor, Cuisinart! Now I have TWO of your machines that I can no longer use.)
customer_reviews.author: L F

customer_reviews.title: Not very good quality of doesn't last a month
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one on Sept 14th, it has quit working as has past ones I have purchased. Not very good quality of doesn't last a month.
customer_reviews.author: amanda

customer_reviews.title: In ALL aspects, a GREAT hand mixer!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was VERY hesitant at buying this because of some of the reviews and I’m soooo glad I didn’t let them sway me. I am telling you that this is a TERRIFIC hand mixer. It is lightweight, powerful, AND what a GREAT idea for storing the beaters!! I don’t have to dig for them in my drawer anymore!!! I made cookie dough with no problem. I have mashed potatoes, beat eggs, and made whipped cream. It’s GREAT!!!! It’s a beast, in a good way🙃🙃 It is very well made and so are the beaters. Overall I am VERY glad I bought this!!!
customer_reviews.author: wolfpause

customer_reviews.title: Bad purchase
customer_reviews.text: I read reviews before I bought this mixer and thought it was a good choice. I have had this for over a year now and each time I use it I am angry that I wanted my money on a bad mixer. The cord is the biggest problem. It’s thick and very hard to rotate and it causes the mixer to not be able to stand when you set it down after mixing with wet attachments and it always falls over. Also the attachments are cheap and thin. The storage for the cord is hard to use. I really despise using it! Please pick something else unless you want to be constantly frustrated and making a mess!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie K.

customer_reviews.title: Power+++
customer_reviews.text: I was reluctant to replace my 40 year old hand mixer because is was still going strong and doing a fine job. Now I regret waiting so long to join the new generation of mixers. This mixer is lightweight, has tremendous power (powers through cookie dough) clean-up and storage is eezy peezy. For those that complained the mixer would come undone from the case, "read the instructions" it works as advertised. I would recommend that you not have the mixer in the bowl at turn on, as it does start faster than the slowest speed, so start first then immerse for best results.
customer_reviews.author: Dubbia

customer_reviews.title: You'e lost a customer!
customer_reviews.text: So sad to tell you that this is my SECOND, of the same mixer, and both have died an untimely death after being used only a few time. (Only two of us live here.) I liked it's performance while it lived, but so sad that a mixer with this "name" and price would not have a longer life span. Soooo, this is the last Cuisinart I'll purchase. Sorry folks, burial has taken place and closure is now.
customer_reviews.author: CRH

customer_reviews.title: Best Hand Mixer
customer_reviews.text: This is the best hand mixer I have owned. At sixty plus years, that is quiet a few. Weight is good as is the balance. Various speeds will do any job you wish. I like the slow start to avoid splatters. Easy to clean. Whipping blade works well. Have not tried the dough hook. Best of all is the compartment design for storing attachments. Now when I reach in the cabinet for the mixer, I don't have to hunt for the other parts. No problems with mixer coming out of the container when I pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hildebrandt

customer_reviews.title: Used it once.  Unbearably loud.
customer_reviews.text: Liked - packaging - easy to put everything in the base for storage. I could not use this mixer again. I tried once - unbearably loud. I do believe this could damage your hearing. It did the job, but I would never use it again. Not even exchanging. I'll go back to my 53-year old Black and Decker hand mixer while I look for another brand that doesn't sound like a jet engine! Maybe it was just defective, but I'll try something else.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Fangmann

customer_reviews.title: Attachments! Noise level is good for a mixer. Good purchase if lasts.
customer_reviews.text: A first look review. I spent hours deciding which hand mixer to get after mine wouldn't stay on by itself. Even though I didn't need the chunk of plastic storage bin, I really needed dough hooks! This is really the only one under $100 with one that was a known company. Looks nice. Used it once so far to mix irish soda bread. Didn't get too much flour everywhere, so that is a plus. For a mixer, it wasn't overly loud, which is great! So far, I'm happy with it and think it's a good purchase right now.
customer_reviews.author: ARBY

customer_reviews.title: You'll be amazed
customer_reviews.text: If you've been using a standard hand mixer, trade it in right now for this mixer. I had a decent hand mixer, but there's no comparison. I was looking for something so I didn't have to lug my KitchenAid out every time I needed a mixer. Let's get it the KitchenAid is great, but it's really HEAVY. This Cuisinart has plenty of power for anything you would every make - short of kneading dough. The self contained storage is great. No more fishing around in the utensil drawer to find that second beater.
customer_reviews.author: Jill MCFARLAND

customer_reviews.title: Amazon wake up and provide proper data on products, particularly voltage
customer_reviews.text: The product is good quality and does the job. However, the promotion add said 220 Watt, but did not indicate the voltage was only 120 volt. The voltage in Thailand. is 220 volts as is the voltage in China where this was made. This has happend a few times when purhasing from Amazon and I do not think enough effort is made to ensure the proper voltages is displayed. I would award the product 4 stars but Amazon 0 stars on this count.
customer_reviews.author: Dr Sam Cummings

customer_reviews.title: This broke within 2 months
customer_reviews.text: The beaters no longer spin and it makes a loud grinding noise within 2 months of purchase. I purchased extended warranty on it, registered the product on Cuisinart.ca, and have filed 2 warranty claims, but cannot get ahold of anyone at Cuisinart to help me. They say I have to return it through Amazon, but the order is now closed. Not pleased with this purchase or the customer service that comes along with it.
customer_reviews.author: Breanne

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart Hand Mixer - Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: I waited a while to post after using this several times and before anyone wonders, no, I didn't get a discount or free product. I researched hand mixers as this was actually for my mom. I typically use my stand mixer but she doesn't cook enough for something that large. After reading all the reviews I went with this. This thing is the Cadillac of hand mixers. Comes with several different attachments that store nicely in the plastic compartment. No more hunting for the inserts. The speed indicator is digital. I'm really pleased with this. Very heavy duty. Oh the joy of making whipped cream with this mixer! Whipped potatoes? No problem at all.
customer_reviews.author: K. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Finally treated myself to a new hand mixer! Woohoo
customer_reviews.text: finally replaced our 20 year old hand mixer. Very pleased with new Cuisinart mixer. I love the storage container for holding all parts (no more digging in the kitchen tool drawer to try and find the mixer blades!). When you turn it on, it is automatically at speed 1, which is very slow. I like the +/- buttons to increase speeds as you are mixing. Update: downgraded rating due to mixer unable to make smooth mashed potatoes. blades don't do good job of fine work on the potatoes. Miss my Hamilton Beach el cheapo mixer!
customer_reviews.author: NPR MANTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great at first. Now it’s an art piece.
customer_reviews.text: The beaters got tangled up in each other while I was mixing a cake batter on level 4 speed. It is now unusable. I’ve had it 2 months and used it maybe 10 times. UPDATE. 10/1/19 I received a replacement and have used a few times. I’m a little nervous about using it considering the experience I had but I will use the mixer anyway. If the replacement breaks I’m moving to a different brand. I don’t think wire beaters are a great idea.
customer_reviews.author: Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for occasional baking
customer_reviews.text: My 10-year old Hamilton hand mixer broke and I needed a new mixer. I don't bake a lot and couldn't justify the cost of the fancy Kitchen-Aid countertop mixers, but this Cusinart mixer seems to do the trick. I like the storage case and was able to fit all of the attachments in the box, including the cord. I've only used it once but it was easy to use and felt very sturdy. I look forward to future baking opportunities with this mixer!
customer_reviews.author: K. nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Awesome hand mixer
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a back-up to my 40 year old West Bend hand mixer that was beginning to show age related issues. This is a great hand mixer. All accessories store neatly with the mixer, sits nicely on the counter with beaters over bowl, plenty of power. The beaters have to be put in the correct slots in the mixer or they will not lock in. There is a configuration on the bottom of the mixer showing which beater goes in which hole.
customer_reviews.author: kathut

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product! I would highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love my new mixer! I have a very old hand mixer and love it but we furnished a rental and I put it in the rental. I read a lot of reviews on several mixers and decided on this one. You have to make sure to put the correct beater in the correct hole our it'll fall out. That was some of the negative comments I read but they just didn't see the indication on the mixer itself. Problem solved and it works wonderfully! I love the storage unit; everything in one place when I need it!
customer_reviews.author: karen wescott

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart quality is not as good as it used to be.
customer_reviews.text: I used this mixer for baking and I do not bake very often mostly around the holidays. It was purchased in February 2018 and today it quit working. Cuisinart is my go to brand for home appliances and they have always performed well. The last hand mixer I had for several years before it quit working and my food processor is still going strong. Needless to say I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: lillian pinto

customer_reviews.title: Good mixer for lighter use
customer_reviews.text: They don't make hand helds like they used to., I miss the 'solid' feel of the old ones. It does wobble after a while. This one comes with 'dough hooks' -- I tried them for cookie dough, and would have gotten better results with my hands. They are quite skinny and frankly aren't worth using at all. I do like the storage compartment; it helps the mixer rest in my cupboard and I know where the beaters are.
customer_reviews.author: Hope5253

customer_reviews.title: Beaters rust
customer_reviews.text: The beaters on this rust. I thought the first one I ordered was perhaps just a dud. I ordered a second based on the general good name of the brand, but the beaters rust if put in the dish washer. I personally don’t use rusty beaters for my cookie dough, so it feels like the high price for a hand-held beater was a horrible purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Julie W. Osburn

customer_reviews.title: Soft start isn't great.
customer_reviews.text: I like nearly every thing about this hand mixer except I wish it came in pink, since that is the wifes favorite color, and the soft/slow start was actually soft/slow. When mixing powdered sugar, cornstarch, or even just flour and you put the beaters in the bowl and turn it on to level 1 it comes on fast and then slows down. First time I did this was making a glaze with powdered sugar and it flew every where. So if using with light powders be sure to start the beaters out of the bowl and then put them into the ingredients. Other than that I love everything about this hand mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: One fatal flaw
customer_reviews.text: It' was a great mixer - for about two weeks. Now it's a $70 paperweight. One of the two mixer blades now refuses to click into place, no matter how hard I push. A mixer with one blade that keeps falling out into the batter is useless. And of course, I threw out the box, so I can't return it! UP)DATE: I emailed Cuisinart and got no reply. So much for Cuisinart!
customer_reviews.author: Heldensop

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 6 months of easy use.
customer_reviews.text: When working, this is a very nice and powerful mixer. The problem is that it broke after about six months of fairly light use. There is a warranty from Cuisinart, but getting hold of Cuisinart has proven far more difficult and time consuming than I would have expected.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Accessory case does not stay on
customer_reviews.text: One of the big reasons I spent more on a hand mixer was to get the snap on attachment case...this one doesn't actually snap on or stay attached. I'm also not crazy about the digital speed buttons. I expect better from the Cuisinart name.
customer_reviews.author: legrue

customer_reviews.title: It's OK....
customer_reviews.text: It's OK, but akward to increase speeds with. Also, the mixer seems just a little under-powered. I don't know how long it's going to last, but I doubt it will last a full year. I use it to bake with, about 2-3 times a week... It just doesn't seem very stout nor solid.....better than just my hand whisk though, but that's the best I can say about it. Better than my hand whisk. I wouldn't buy it again, but would seek something with greater quality and more power. The beaters are easy enough to clean, but again....they seem cheaply constructed.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Gross

customer_reviews.title: I love it.
customer_reviews.text: I actually stopped baking because my Kitchen Aide was too heavy to get out for most of my baking. I bake again. It's got enough power to do what I want it to do. I love that it has a little resting thing so you can take it out and put it to the side. I like the storage unit it comes in although it takes a few time before you get it right. I'm glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Hand Mixer
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this instead of the Kitchen Aid hand mixer. After using it several times I find it's quite excellent. My only gripe is that I wish it had a comfort handle. Basically a little padding would be nice for mildly arthritic hands. Otherwise, it is lightweight, easy to clean, and whips heavy whipping cream in record time!
customer_reviews.author: kbdietrick

customer_reviews.title: For small kitchens
customer_reviews.text: Works great and I like the storage option. My kitchen is small so I store it under the sink where it took almost no space. Speed gauge also convenient when I’m doing the cakes.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart does not repair or service its hand mixers
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware. If and when your hand mixer dies, Cuisinart does NOT repair them and they do not have any outside service centers to repair them. So you should know that your warranty may be of limited value.
customer_reviews.author: KRoss

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this last week and received it this weekend. Opened the box, attached the beaters, turned on the mixer, and one of the beaters keeps falling out! I tried multiple times and felt it click in (or lock in place), but as soon as I turned the mixer on, it fell out. My husband even tried. Running a mixer is not rocket science. This mixer is being returned pronto.
customer_reviews.author: JJAC

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made product, do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very disappointed with this Cuisinart hand mixer. I purchased this at the end of April and have used it less than 10 times in 5 months and it has decided to stop working entirely. The motor still runs but none of the wisks spin! If I could give this zero stars, I would. I've purchased multiple Cuisinart products before because I could count on quality but that ends today.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Soliman

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous design, powerful & easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: You have a stand mixer?! That's so 1990s.... Why would you have something taking up precious countertop space when you can have something that's way lighter, easily stows away to declutter your kitchen & just as useful? Unless you're using a mixer multiple times a week, this is THE best option out there. I use it on stiff bread dough, whipped cream, cakes, etc. I love my old Cuisinart food processor, but now they come out with self stowing hand mixer?!
customer_reviews.author: C. Jones

customer_reviews.title: If you're in the market, buy this one.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best hand mixer I've ever used, hands down. I've had it for 2 years, and have never gone all the way up to 9, but I don't make bread. It's a fantastic mixer that really holds up. I've used it in place of a stand mixer several times as well, and it always performs admirably. Whenever this one dies, I'm buying another. My mother coveted mine so much I gave her one for her birthday and she was delighted. I would love a spatula attachment to be able to use it more like a stand mixer, but that's a very minor thing.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Apart from the initial surge, a very good mixer
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this unit. It does everything that I need it to do. The carrier for the implements is a huge plus for keeping everything together when you need it. I have not ever had the reason to use the dough hooks, but will update if I do. The only complaint is the initially aggressive surge upon startup before settling into its intended speed. It could cause some unintended messes if you're not careful. Beyond that, I would definitely recommend this product to anyone in the market for a hand mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Firanek

customer_reviews.title: Great for a Kitchen with little "Real Estate"
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant when I got this, but I have to tell you it really is perfect for me. I am no a "baker'" but do like to make muffins, breakfast breads, waffles etc. The Power advantage handles those and provides the whip you want for fluff. I only rated versatility at 4 because I think it would struggle with heavy mixes. Beyond that if you have a small kitchen and want a machine that works without taking up a huge part of your counter, this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Trish Telesco

customer_reviews.title: Good blender !
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I didn’t give this all 5 stars is because of the bottom part of the blender wouldn’t ever stay on it. It just ended up becoming a pain in the butt
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Love it and love the little storage compartment.
customer_reviews.text: This is a huge upgrade for my home. I love it thus far and seems like it will last. I saw people complaining that all the stuff doesn’t fit in the clear storage compartment at the bottom but mine fits everything with no problem. I don’t have to shove it down or anything. Not sure what they are doing wrong but no worries about getting this.
customer_reviews.author: CPCO

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: It works. The best feature is the slow start. I used it on cookie dough at setting 5 and it started wobbling/shaking a bit. Tried it again on a less dense dough and same thing happened. I read other reviews stating the same issue so I guess its just a thing with this model. Other than that it does as advertised and I'm okay with it. The case doesn't close very tightly. It often pops open when I go to pick up the unit.
customer_reviews.author: shandris

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: Not that happy with this blender, it works but I don’t like that it speeds up when I’m on level 1 trying to mix slowly and if you try to set it on the counter it tips over 90 percent of the time due to the design and poor location of the power chord.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love the option of pushing the button so effortlessly to make the mixer beat faster or slow it down. The release button is easy to operate as well. Easy all in one storage container is the finishing touch I expected. Thank You
customer_reviews.author: Frannie

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This easy to use has it's own storage compartment for compactness. The mixer works great on lighter fair and it looks sleek and modern. We'll use it when our heavy duty mixer is tied up doing something else.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin B. Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Great mixer with storage included.
customer_reviews.text: A very well made mixer. I have used a KitchenAid for many years, but needed a better way to store the utensils. This design does it, and the 9 speeds are much more flexible. The accessory I like best is the whisk. Goes thru cream or egg whites, whipping them up fluffy and smooth and you always feel in control..Highest marks as a useful kitchen tool, perfect for my soufflés, etc. I like everything about it, and using it often.
customer_reviews.author: Coy F.

customer_reviews.title: You will love storing your beaters with the mixer.
customer_reviews.text: Really LOVE this mixer. Looked for a long time and extremely glad I picked this one. Love the fact that everything stores together, no more lost or bent beaters. The power is great, it's lightweight but sturdy. beaters were a different shape than my 30 year old one so I wasn't sure they would work as well, but they work great. Cord stores too.
customer_reviews.author: MidwestLady

customer_reviews.title: Way better then any Kitchen-Aid hand mixer!
customer_reviews.text: Best Handmixer to have! I bought another brand (kitchen-aid) mixer for the holidays and was happy with it until I started mixing doughish consistency. I used my sister Cuisinart and was blown away by it. I immediately went home and found and bought this mixer. It was so many nice features. To control the speed it is digital so you gradually go higher, but if you need to shut it off immediately it has an easy on and off button. Best feature so far. The disk is great! and it all store in the bottom including the cord. Great, fantastic, amazing product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amada_love

customer_reviews.title: but the spindly blades are not my favorite as they don't do a great job at scraping ...
customer_reviews.text: The mixer is powerful, but the spindly blades are not my favorite as they don't do a great job at scraping the sides of the bowl. I have an old B&D hand mixer that has a snap-on bowl scraper that works so well, but the motor on that mixer was getting tired and could not handle thick mixtures. I still use it for mixing cake batter, but reach for this Cuisinart when I have the need for speed to handle thick dough, which it does well.
customer_reviews.author: CAGirl

customer_reviews.title: Good for light use
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Some drawbacks are the power extension wire is awkward to put in the casing when storing, the blades are bordering flimsy and the whisk attachment (1) is very small. This is great for small light use but I had to go back to my kitchen aide for cookies, meringues and other heavier batters.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Brunner

customer_reviews.title: Great product...heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: I'm a professional pastry chef...and this little machine ticks all the boxes. Sturdy...has POWER....has choices.....you feel like you have a power drill in your hand. someone else was put off by how it speeds up a bit before it slows down....but I guess I had read that and was ready for it. No biggie. This is the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Nice Product
customer_reviews.text: This mixer is nice, works well for a handheld mixer, just not quite as well as my old mixer which had three beaters rather than two. I give it 4 stars due to the fact that it is a bit difficult to raise and lower speed while using the mixer. I have to use both hands to do that.
customer_reviews.author: Jewels

customer_reviews.title: Great powerful hand mixer
customer_reviews.text: Very powerful hand mixer. Comes with whisk, beaters and dough hooks. I like that it starts off slow so the batter doesn’t splash everywhere. Comes with the storage compartment that snaps on. I wish it snapped on a bit more tightly, but it works well enough. The design of the beaters is especially nice as it makes for easy cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: AKN

customer_reviews.title: I like the quality of the pieces that get affixed
customer_reviews.text: I like the quality of the pieces that get affixed. However, the lowest speed is really fast. Also, the way the base attaches doesn't seem like it's going to last very long. It's already failing and I've only used it a handful of times. A plus is that there is a slight delay in when you press the start button and the actual start of the mixer. That helps mitigate, slightly, the speed of the first setting.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Ellett

customer_reviews.title: Great design, plenty of power
customer_reviews.text: Every bit as good as other reviewers said it would be. My favorite part has to be the power, but the convenient storage is absolutely best in class. My neighbor borrowed it—and promptly ordered one for herself!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Buyers Beware: Terrible Mixer
customer_reviews.text: I paid over $60 for this mixer thinking this was a high quality brand and product. I don’t cook a lot anymore and have not used the mixer more than 5 times, and it is already broken. I am angry and disappointed with this mixer. Cuisinart does provide good customer service and replaced the mixer. I am hoping this one will last longer.
customer_reviews.author: redvlvt1

customer_reviews.title: Great product, compact storage.
customer_reviews.text: Compact storage, easy to use features. You can’t go wrong with this mixer, it’s a must have for That person looking to replace an old mixer or step up to a new.
customer_reviews.author: Weekend golfer

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart Power Advantage 9 speed handheld mixer
customer_reviews.text: This little number is a powerful mixer for only being a handheld. I love that everything is contained in the attachable plastic bin. No more searching through drawers looking for the beaters. Everything is right there all together. I would certainly buy this one again!
customer_reviews.author: Trisha Miller

customer_reviews.title: Works great and looks great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Buttons easy to press. Only negative is the bottom compartment doesn't click in very well. Also have had issues putting beaters in a few times didn't lock in. But overall it works great for what I need.
customer_reviews.author: lhaworth

customer_reviews.title: Noisy product, nine speeds are over-kill, three speeds are enough for all my whipping needs.
customer_reviews.text: Like the performance of the mixer and the ability to keep everything stored in one place however it is so noisy. I actually put in ear plugs when I use this product. Recently purchased the Cuisinart Power Select 3 Speed Hand Mixer and found it to be a little quieter. It does not have the storage convenience and found three speeds complete the job, there is no need for nine speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this little mixer
customer_reviews.text: Best money I spent on a mixer. I have a Bosch stand mixer that I can add attachments too, and I love it to death. However I have limited counter space and the stand mixer can't stay on it all the time I just don't have the large mixing jobs that often. I choose a model with dough hooks reasoning that if it could knead dough, it must have a strong motor and gears. I have used this mixer half a dozen times now and it has not disappointed me so far. I like the feature that senses how much torque is needed, no matter the speed, and adjusts accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Heavy G

customer_reviews.title: I love the storage and strength
customer_reviews.text: The idea of all the beaters being kept neatly in one place sold me on this mixer...but it has real strength for a hand mixer. A bit heavy, but still comfortable
customer_reviews.author: Sweetsmom

customer_reviews.title: Easy storage, compact shape
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for my mother, then I decided to buy one for myself. I like the area for storage and the unit being lightweight. The brand is really good, and so far the unit has been easy to use and clean. It makes a nice addition to the kitchen tools one may already have.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Astounding
customer_reviews.text: I just love this.I use it to make a feathery light keto cheesecake and it is the bomb. I have a huge clunky cuisinart food processor that i regret buying and is to heavy to lug out .This little gem is al that i ever needed .I love it!
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Don't purchase.
customer_reviews.text: purchased this in July and used it one time just fine. Went to use it again on Thanksgiving to do some mashed potatoes and only one of the two beater blades would stay in. Absolutely useless. Would love to return it but apparently it has been too long.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the mixer,  Good seller
customer_reviews.text: America's Test Kitchen recommended this few years back. Bought a new one gave the old one to child. Cheaper than a stand mixer
customer_reviews.author: Aussie

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Love this mixer, very powerful. My only complaint is that, when you first turn it on, it “slow starts” for you, but this is not an accurate description. It starts slowly enough, true, but then it goes up to speed 9 very quickly (it seems) before quickly slowing back down to the chosen speed. Make sure the beaters are fully submerged before turning it on!
customer_reviews.author: sewgr8nct

customer_reviews.title: ... used to have an old Oster hand mixer and loved it, but the speed switch broke off (after ...
customer_reviews.text: I used to have an old Oster hand mixer and loved it, but the speed switch broke off (after more than 20 years of use). Looked at all of the ratings and ended up with this one. While it gets the job done, I don't like the weenie attachments (my old mixer could have been used to mix cement it was so sturdy). And when you stand it on the counter, it frequently tips over because it doesn't have a good solid "base" and I also think it is because the cord pushes it over. I'll keep it, but will miss my old mixer every time use this one.
customer_reviews.author: KJS

customer_reviews.title: My family really likes this mixer. It's an ingenious ...
customer_reviews.text: My family really likes this mixer. It's an ingenious idea having it set up the way it is. Just be sure to snap the bottom piece on well each time, as it will drive you crazy when it comes off while picking it up. Everything falls out and it'll make you jump!
customer_reviews.author: Terry H.

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best and most powerful mixer I have ever had! Its beautiful, and love how everything stays together, and though, it takes a while to get used to how they have the buttons set up without going over the speed you want, its great! you will love this!
customer_reviews.author: ivy cook

customer_reviews.title: Great mixer, not great lid
customer_reviews.text: This mixer works great! I love the range of speeds, and it's sleek looking, so that makes this baker happy. The reason I docked a star is because the lid does not stay on. It's great for storage, but don't expect to be able to pick up the handle without holding the case as well. It doesn't matter to me that much because I only wanted that lid for storage purposes, but it is a little annoying. The mixer itself is great, though and I'd highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen T.

customer_reviews.title: Cuisinart is always good
customer_reviews.text: This is a perfect hand mixer! Cuisinart rarely disappoints. Great power, not too loud and east to store.
customer_reviews.author: lisa r robinson

customer_reviews.title: My first attempt they clicked in like they were supossed to but when I turned it ...
customer_reviews.text: Beaters have to go into the unit on a specific side and they are not marked left or right. My first attempt they clicked in like they were supossed to but when I turned it on they flew out of the hand held unit. I figured it out but they really should be marked left and right. Otherwise, it is a great mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Donna E.

customer_reviews.title: I love mine
customer_reviews.text: I love my hand mixer. I like that all the components fit nicely into the storage area and you can put it away neatly. Also, when I first start up the mixer, it starts up slowly so you don't get a big splash. And it has a lot of speed settings.
customer_reviews.author: alohanoa

customer_reviews.title: Bestbuy
customer_reviews.text: I love this mixer, everything about it and I have bought it for four of my friends/relatives. Here's the deal: comes with a storage unit so you're not looking for the parts; powerful; compact (I love this aspect as I have a big ole stand mixer & sometimes I don't need to haul it out). I recommend highly.
customer_reviews.author: Judy Bresnan

customer_reviews.title: Engine burned out in 3 months.
customer_reviews.text: liked it initially, and usu have decent luck w Cuisinart.. Did not want to pay the price for KitchenAid. However, the units motor burned out after only 3 mo of use -cakes, cookies, basic batters. Very disappointed w this. I expected better.. If I had wanted Hamilton Beach Quality, I would have gotten Hamilton Beach for much less.
customer_reviews.author: DGBrew

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good product!
customer_reviews.text: Good quality, solid material (but light!), wonderful design Speed 1 and 2 are very gentle, perfect to stir and mix without over work the dough. Bravo! Speed 8 and 9 are OMG! really fast. Storage box is study, solid, clean and very handy! (Watch my video!) Very fast shipping! 4 days before the real shipping date. I strongly recommend this seller!
customer_reviews.author: Adolpho Kepler

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use, Clean, Store
customer_reviews.text: Use it frequently because it's easy to use, clean, and store. Haven't had any operational issues yet.
customer_reviews.author: Cass

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this mixer
customer_reviews.text: Works GREAT. Wonderful performance, never lets me down. Awesome storage bin too!! Would definitely buy again. Easy to use and exactly as described
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Excellent packaging and built to handle the toughest blending jobs
customer_reviews.text: we had the previous version - and the cord eventually wore out at the base. But the compact storage and capability of this blender is well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Christ

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I like this one and I’ve had many. I like the slow start feature.
customer_reviews.author: D. Markley

customer_reviews.title: this thing is cool!
customer_reviews.text: i like the dough hooks! it is a little heavy though, but it doesn't bother me that it weighs a little more then others mixers i've owned, i guess it has to if you're going to knead dough with it, my other mixers didn't do that. a smaller motor wouldn't have the power to knead the dough and would just burn up i figure. this one feels pretty rugged so i haven't been afraid to abuse it a little and it's held up great so far. i like the l.e.d. speed display. the other attachments are great too and i like the way it's easy to store and keep everything together. great product
customer_reviews.author: Scott E. Statler

customer_reviews.title: Very nice hand-held mixer
customer_reviews.text: I was surprised how much I liked this mixer. It is easy to use and everything stores easily in the storage case.
customer_reviews.author: lily42

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money, gears fail if you use high speed.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great first two times I used it. Was making cake icing and beaters jumped out of sync with each other. The mixer is now useless. For the price paid for this mixer it should last more then three times.
customer_reviews.author: realistic

customer_reviews.title: Very Good mixer
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this mixer, very easy to use and clean. And you can see what's in the container.
customer_reviews.author: Big Bodie

customer_reviews.title: Speed reduced in heavy batter
customer_reviews.text: It's loud, but probably to be expected. The speed is greatly reduced when in heavy material. The reduction is at least by half. What others have said regarding torque isn't true in my case. On '1' the lowest speed, it almost seems that it will stop. My fear is the motor will burn up. Not really impressed given the price. I wanted a top of the line mixer, this is not it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great Hand Mixer!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Cuisinart hand mixer, my first was excellent, but I was ready to move up! This appears to be an excellent hand mixer and an excellent value. The only concern I have is when the mixer is first started, it seems to bog a bit, as if the power were not entirely there, then quickly "catch up". Not sure what that means since I just got the mixer, but if it is anything like my previous Cuisinart hand mixer, I'll be more than happy. UPDATE: July 2014. Excellent mixer, no issues at all!!!! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Vicki of CA

customer_reviews.title: Slow and loud
customer_reviews.text: I love this new design that allows you to store it inside the provided container. My only issue is when operating the mixer the motor seems to slow down while in use, then pick back up on and off. The item is also quite loud.
customer_reviews.author: Justmecc

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Easy to use and love that it is small and doesn't take a lot space in my kitchen. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Betty

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Great little handheld mixer. If I had any complaint, it would probably be that i wish the cord was longer.
customer_reviews.author: Alicia M

customer_reviews.title: Bummer for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Really like the attachments and housing for them is genius; however the mixer comes on so fast, even at the lowest speed that it throws dry ingredients right out of the bowl (even deep bowls) and there is something wrong with the design as your hand tires quickly while mixing - something I don't have trouble with on other hand mixers.
customer_reviews.author: D. Gerard

customer_reviews.title: No speed] less] than Mach 2...flings dough/batter everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a replacement for my favorite long Lived mixer , did some research, bought this one and although it is strong-it is very noisy and has no speed less than Mach 2 in its repertoire. I will only use it for cookies or breads and I will have to look further for my everyday mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Karin O'Neill

customer_reviews.title: Run away
customer_reviews.text: This product is beyond terrible. The only reason I gave it a star at all is that there is no way to post this huge warning to others without rating it. All of the manufacturing costs went to making this joke of a product shiny with nifty storage for the beaters etc. The last mixer I had was not nearly so flashy but it had two important features that this piece of trash is missing: the two most important things: the beaters mounted easily, it was clear how to do it, and I didn’t have to wrestle to take them out because there was a release button. I think I’ll gift this to someone I don’t like
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this produce as it provides the power and versatility ...
customer_reviews.text: I love this produce as it provides the power and versatility that i need in the kitchen, yet i dont have to have a big, heavy ugly appliance continually on my countertop. It is chrome, sharp looking, and packs away nicely. Just my cup of tea!
customer_reviews.author: marilyn

customer_reviews.title: Good price, good product
customer_reviews.text: I wish there was a little more power. But, I like the storage feature.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and compact
customer_reviews.text: I like that this has all it's attachments together. It works well and is easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: LolaW

customer_reviews.title: This is such a nice handy kitchen tool
customer_reviews.text: This is such a nice handy kitchen tool. I use it in my small vacation apartment. It performs as well as a full-size hand held and is light and easy to control.
customer_reviews.author: Mee

customer_reviews.title: Terrific little mixer
customer_reviews.text: I have been very happy with this mixer overall. Previous reviews are right, it can be tedious trying to get the cord in to snap on the lid and the lowest setting does move faster than I'd like. You have to be careful to avoid dry ingredients flying out of the bowl on the first setting. It can be done if you finesse it but if the blades spinned slower on the first setting you wouldn't need to be careful. Apart from that it's been fabulous.
customer_reviews.author: Alchemy1966

customer_reviews.title: Love this blender
customer_reviews.text: Love the storage container on the bottom - everything fits very neatly back where it belongs - no looking for beaters in the accessory drawer! Works very well.
customer_reviews.author: Alisa B

customer_reviews.title: Item is fine - too expensive
customer_reviews.text: This item is not Stainless Steel - it is silver painted plastic. There is a perfectly good Hamilton Beach product for about $14 - which I have used for years - buy that item instead of this item. Too expensive
customer_reviews.author: Celia M Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Mixer!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second mixer of this same model. I bought one for our camper because I didn't want to haul my stand mixer around with me. This was an excellent choice because it is compact and everything is stored together. I love it so much that I always had it in my house and never had it in the camper. I now have one for each location and use them all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Sara A

customer_reviews.title: Light-Weight Workhorse
customer_reviews.text: This mixer gets the job done. I've used the regular and whisk beaters and they got the job done. Even though light-weight, the mixer can mix stiff batters. I've had several hand mixers over the years and this is the best, yet!!
customer_reviews.author: Madicasper

product_meta.title: Cuisinart HM-90BCS Power Advantage Plus 9-Speed Handheld Mixer with Storage Case, Brushed Chrome
product_meta.description:
Color:ChromeIntroducing a hand mixer that's as easy to put away as it is to operate. The Cuisinart Power Advantage Plus 9 Speed Hand Mixer performs any task a recipe calls for, and then tucks into its own storage case. Once it has mixed heavy batters, whipped up fluffy meringues and kneaded homemade bread dough, just clean it up and put it away. Extra long beaters, chef's whisk, and dough hooks fit into a clear case, and the mixer snaps on top. Plenty of power, perfect control, and compact storage. That's a mixer anyone can love. Features: 220 watts of power with automatic feedback|SmoothStart™ feature with 3 low mixing speeds eliminates splattering|One-step power switch with 9-speed LED display|Sturdy snap-on case to store mixer and accessories|Includes beaters chef’s whisk dough hooks and spatula|Recipe book|Limited 3-year warranty|BPA Free

BRAND STORY
By Cuisinart
feature_bullets: Handheld mixer with 220-watt motor and automatic feedback;BPA Free
Simple on/off button; 1-touch speed control and 9 speed options
3 low start speeds to prevent ingredients from splattering; snap-on clear storage case
Includes beaters, chef's whisk, dough hooks, spatula, and instruction/recipe book
Measures approximately 8-1/2 by 3-8/9 by 8-8/9 inches; 3-year limited warranty
NOTE: Refer the User Manual before use.
Handheld mixer with 220-watt motor and automatic feedback
Simple on/off button; 1-touch speed control and 9 speed options
3 low start speeds to prevent ingredients from splattering, Sturdy snap-on case for storage
Includes beaters, chef's whisk, dough hooks, spatula, and instruction/recipe book
Measures approximately 8-1/2 by 3-8/9 by 8-8/9 inches; 3-year limited warranty
